Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Frank Chandler Papers TAM 286
0.25 Linear Feet (1 box)
undated 1
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials were found in repository, but the collection was likely donated by Henry Foner in circa 1997. The accession number related to this collection is 1997.067.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Historical/Biographical Note
Frank Chandler (1903-1992) was a trade union and community activist. His original name was Frank Tschinder. Frank worked as a punch press operator in New Jersey before joining the army in 1942. He left the army with an honorable discharge in 1945.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Frank Chandler Papers; TAM 286; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains documents related to his service in the United States military, an application for citizenship, birth certificate, passport, and death certificate.
Conditions Governing Use
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain in 2062.
Labor union members |z New Jersey. Foner, Henry Chandler, Frank, 1903-1992
